episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the filming quirks of Daniel Day-Lewis in 'My Left Foot', the unique protest methods of French unions, the unusual triggers of epileptic fits, and the censorship of French newspapers during World War I.

facts.fact: A lot of the Daniel Day-Lewis movie, My Left Foot, was filmed using his right foot.
Some French unions have special barbecues that can be used to cook sausages while on a protest march.
Epileptic fits can be triggered by thinking about toothpaste.

Things that French newspapers were censored from mentioning during World War I included any use of the word peace without the word victorious, any mention of the cold weather, and any reference of a meeting between the president's wife and a wild ape.
